title: Software Developer
description:
Company Description
 



  





 FasTutorAI is a pioneering EdTech platform transforming education through intelligent, personalized, and interactive learning experiences. By leveraging advanced artificial intelligence and modern software engineering, we empower learners to achieve meaningful academic and career outcomes. Our mission is to make high\\-quality education accessible, scalable, and adaptable through innovative technology. At FasTutorAI, we are committed to shaping the future of learning with integrity, creativity, and human\\-centered design.
 



  





  





  





 Role Description
 



  





 FasTutorAI is seeking a Software Developer to design, build, and maintain software solutions that support our AI\\-driven learning platform. This full\\-time remote role involves developing user\\-facing features, backend services, and system integrations that enhance the overall learning experience.
 



  





 The Software Developer will collaborate with product managers, AI/ML engineers, designers, and content teams to deliver high\\-quality, reliable, and performant software. This position is ideal for someone who values clean coding practices, innovation, and contributing to an impactful mission.
 



  





  





  





 Key Responsibilities
 



  





 Software Design \\& Development
 



 • Develop and maintain frontend, backend, or full\\-stack applications depending on skillset.
 



 • Implement new features and enhancements aligned with product requirements and user needs.
 



 • Build reusable, scalable, and performant components and services.
 



 • Write clean, well\\-documented, and well\\-tested code following engineering best practices.
 



  





 System Integration \\& Architecture
 



 • Integrate APIs, databases, and third\\-party services into the platform.
 



 • Contribute to technical design discussions and architectural decisions.
 



 • Participate in code reviews, refactoring activities, and continuous improvement initiatives.
 



  





 Troubleshooting \\& Optimization
 



 • Diagnose, debug, and resolve software issues across the stack.
 



 • Optimize application performance, stability, and security.
 



 • Collaborate with QA and engineering teams to ensure robustness and reliability in production environments.
 



  





 Cross\\-Functional Collaboration
 



 • Work with product, design, and AI teams to translate technical and functional requirements into scalable solutions.
 



 • Participate in agile development processes, including sprint planning and standups.
 



 • Communicate progress, risks, and technical challenges clearly and effectively.
 



  





  





  





 Qualifications
 



  





 Required
 



 • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
 



 • Proficiency in at least one major programming language: Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, or Go.
 



 • Experience with backend or frontend development frameworks (e.g., FastAPI, Django, Node.js, React).
 



 • Strong understanding of software engineering principles, data structures, and algorithms.
 



 • Experience with databases (SQL or NoSQL) and API\\-driven development.
 



 • Proficiency with Git and modern development workflows.
 



  





 Preferred
 



 • Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
 



 • Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and CI/CD pipelines.
 



 • Experience with AI or data\\-integrated applications.
 



 • Exposure to EdTech platforms or learning technologies.
 



  





  





  





 What FasTutorAI Offers
 



 • Opportunity to build technology that directly impacts students, educators, and global learning communities.
 



 • A collaborative, mission\\-driven engineering culture focused on innovation and quality.
 



 • Remote work flexibility and autonomy in task execution.
 



 • Professional development in system design, AI integration, cloud architecture, and modern software practices.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description
 



  





 FasTutorAI is a pioneering EdTech platform transforming education through intelligent, personalized, and interactive learning experiences. By leveraging advanced artificial intelligence and modern software engineering, we empower learners to achieve meaningful academic and career outcomes. Our mission is to make high\\-quality education accessible, scalable, and adaptable through innovative technology. At FasTutorAI, we are committed to shaping the future of learning with integrity, creativity, and human\\-centered design.
 



  





  





 Role Description
 



  





 FasTutorAI is seeking a skilled Software Engineer to design, develop, and enhance scalable applications that power our AI\\-driven learning ecosystem. This full\\-time remote role involves building backend and/or frontend systems, integrating APIs, improving platform performance, and contributing to new product features. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving technical challenges, writing clean and maintainable code, and delivering high\\-quality software that supports learners and educators.
 



  





 You will collaborate with AI/ML engineers, product managers, designers, and content teams to build reliable, intuitive, and impactful solutions across the platform.
 



  





  





 Key Responsibilities
 



  





 Application Development
 



 • Design, implement, and maintain core platform features, services, and integrations.
 



 • Build performant, scalable, and reusable software components using modern frameworks and tools.
 



 • Write clean, secure, well\\-tested, and well\\-documented code.
 



  





 System Architecture \\& Engineering
 



 • Contribute to architectural decisions and technical design discussions.
 



 • Optimize application performance, reliability, and scalability across environments.
 



 • Support API development, database modeling, and cloud infrastructure integrations.
 



  





 Collaboration \\& Delivery
 



 • Work closely with cross\\-functional teams to translate product requirements into technical solutions.
 



 • Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and continuous improvement initiatives.
 



 • Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve production issues as needed.
 



  





  





 Qualifications
 



  





 Required
 



 • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
 



 • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, or Go.
 



 • Experience with backend or full\\-stack development, RESTful APIs, and relational or NoSQL databases.
 



 • Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, software design principles, and version control (Git).
 



 • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast\\-paced, agile environment.
 



  





 Preferred
 



 • Experience with frameworks and tools such as React, Node.js, FastAPI, Django, or Express.
 



 • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker).
 



 • Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and modern DevOps practices.
 



 • Experience in EdTech, AI\\-driven applications, or large\\-scale distributed systems.
 



  





  





 What FasTutorAI Offers
 



 • Opportunity to build software that directly influences learning, equity, and educational innovation.
 



 • A collaborative engineering culture focused on quality, problem\\-solving, and continuous learning.
 



 • Remote work flexibility and autonomy to drive technical solutions.
 



 • Professional growth in software architecture, AI\\-integrated systems, and product development.

title: Software Developer
description:
**About The Company**
 Turing is a leading technology company dedicated to advancing the future of artificial intelligence and software development. Renowned for its innovative approach, Turing collaborates with top\\-tier research institutions and industry leaders to develop cutting\\-edge AI solutions. The company fosters a dynamic environment where talent, creativity, and technological expertise come together to solve complex problems and create impactful products. With a global presence and a commitment to remote work flexibility, Turing empowers professionals worldwide to contribute to transformative projects in AI and software engineering.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking experienced Go developers to join our team in partnership with a prominent AI research laboratory. This role focuses on enhancing next\\-generation AI coding platforms by reviewing and improving AI\\-generated Go code, tackling runtime and scalability challenges, and integrating AI capabilities into real\\-world production systems. As part of this role, you will work remotely, enjoying a flexible schedule that allows you to balance your professional and personal life. The position offers an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of AI research, applying your Go expertise to influence how AI systems learn to generate reliable, scalable, and production\\-ready code.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 The ideal candidate will possess a minimum of 3 years of professional experience in software engineering with a strong focus on Go programming. You should have an in\\-depth understanding of the Go standard library, concurrency patterns, and systems design principles. Proven experience in improving code quality, maintaining large code repositories, and working with version control systems such as GitHub is essential. Contributions to open\\-source projects and familiarity with AI or code\\-generation technologies are highly desirable. Excellent problem\\-solving skills, strong communication abilities in English, and a collaborative mindset are critical to success in this role.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Review and validate AI\\-generated Go code to ensure optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability.
* Identify and resolve complex concurrency, runtime, and scalability issues within Go applications.
* Enhance evaluation workflows through rigorous testing, benchmarking, and adherence to code quality standards.
* Collaborate closely with AI researchers and engineering teams to prioritize tasks and deliver impactful results.
* Contribute to the development of best practices for integrating AI\\-generated code into production environments.
* Maintain and improve large code repositories, ensuring consistency and high standards of code quality.


**Benefits**
 This role offers a range of benefits designed to support your professional growth and personal well\\-being. Enjoy the flexibility of remote work from anywhere in the world, allowing you to create a work environment that suits your lifestyle. The position provides competitive compensation, earning up to $100 per hour, reflecting your expertise and contributions. You will have the opportunity to build unique experience at the intersection of Go programming and AI research, positioning yourself at the forefront of technological innovation. Additionally, you will contribute to high\\-impact projects that influence how AI systems learn and generate scalable, production\\-grade code. Turing also encourages internal referrals, offering incentives for recommending talented professionals within your network.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 Turing is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We value and respect individual differences and are dedicated to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status. We believe that diverse teams drive innovation and excellence, and we are committed to supporting the growth and success of all our employees.

title: MERN Stack Developer
description:
**About The Company**
 Hireologist is a dynamic and innovative technology company dedicated to transforming the hiring landscape through cutting\\-edge solutions. Our platform leverages advanced data analytics, machine learning, and intuitive user interfaces to streamline recruitment processes for organizations across various industries. Committed to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment, Hireologist prides itself on its entrepreneurial spirit, rapid growth, and a strong focus on delivering exceptional value to our clients. Our team comprises passionate professionals who are driven by a shared mission to make hiring smarter, faster, and more efficient.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Mernstack Developer to join our talented engineering team in Bangalore. As a key contributor, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable web applications that serve thousands of users worldwide. This role offers the opportunity to work on high\\-performance real\\-time systems, develop elegant user interfaces, and architect robust backend solutions. You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and global engineering teams to deliver innovative features that enhance our platform’s capabilities. The ideal candidate is passionate about building scalable, efficient, and user\\-centric applications, and thrives in a fast\\-paced startup environment where ownership and initiative are highly valued.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in Computer Science or related fields, with at least 4 to 6 years of professional experience in web application development. You should have a proven track record working extensively with JavaScript and the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js). Proficiency in React, Redux, and TypeScript is essential, along with hands\\-on experience with Node.js and asynchronous programming paradigms. A solid understanding of websockets, observables, and event\\-driven architectures is required. Familiarity with distributed systems, microservices, and relational databases like MySQL will be advantageous. Additionally, experience with CI/CD pipelines, Webpack or Rollup, and building asynchronous web applications (Ajax) is necessary to excel in this role.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Architect and develop scalable, high\\-performance web applications aligned with business requirements.
* Design, implement, and maintain internal tooling, reporting infrastructure, and UI component libraries to ensure consistency and efficiency.
* Write clean, maintainable, and well\\-documented code, with a focus on thorough unit testing and debugging to ensure high quality standards.
* Collaborate with product teams to analyze requirements, provide technical insights, and break down complex features into manageable tasks.
* Work closely with global engineering teams to plan, test, and deploy new features, ensuring seamless integration and performance.
* Manage release cycles, deployment processes, and version control to ensure smooth rollouts for internal stakeholders and clients.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and incorporate best practices into the development lifecycle.


**Benefits**
 At Hireologist, we believe in rewarding our team members with a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your professional and personal growth. We offer competitive salary packages, performance\\-based incentives, and flexible working hours to promote work\\-life balance. Our employees have access to health insurance, including medical and dental coverage, along with wellness programs. We foster a collaborative culture that encourages innovation, continuous learning, and career development through training sessions, workshops, and mentorship programs. Additionally, our modern office space in Bangalore provides a conducive environment for creativity and teamwork, with amenities to support your day\\-to\\-day needs.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 Hireologist is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We believe that diverse teams drive innovation and excellence, and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates. Join us to be part of a forward\\-thinking organization that values your unique perspectives and contributions.

title: Deep Learning Intern (Computer Vision)
description:
**Company Description**

 HawkFranklin Research is a machine learning consulting firm focused on applying artificial intelligence to advance scientific discoveries in a wide range of disciplines, such as physics and genomics. The company specializes in developing custom machine learning solutions, supporting researchers and organizations in integrating AI technologies into their projects. HawkFranklin Research also provides software, research code, and services for re\\-implementing AI models from published research. Committed to open science principles, the organization prioritizes collaboration and sharing insights with the scientific community to drive innovation in research.
   




**Role Description**

 This is a full\\-time remote opportunity for a Deep Learning Intern specializing in Computer Vision. The intern will work on developing and fine\\-tuning deep learning models, implementing state\\-of\\-the\\-art research papers, performing data preprocessing for computer vision tasks, and experimenting with new methodologies to solve complex problems. Responsibilities will also include documenting results, analyzing performance metrics, collaborating with team members, and contributing to research publications and projects.
   




**Qualifications**
* Strong knowledge in Deep Learning concepts and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
* Experience with Computer Vision techniques, including object detection, image segmentation, and feature extraction
* Programming skills in Python and familiarity with libraries such as NumPy, OpenCV, or similar tools
* Background in Machine Learning fundamentals and data processing techniques
* Proficiency in debugging, optimizing, and implementing algorithms from scientific literature
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with attention to detail
* Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field
* Familiarity with scientific research, version control tools (e.g., Git), and cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) is a plus
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work independently in a remote setting

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time

**Title:** 
**Data Engineer**
**Overview**
 A Data Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our data\\-driven decisions. You’ll be at the heart of our data ecosystem, ensuring data is reliably collected, stored, and processed to provide clean, accessible data for our analytics and business intelligence teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design \\& Develop Data Pipelines: Assist in building, maintaining, and optimizing scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines to ingest and transform large datasets from diverse sources, including APIs, databases, and third\\-party systems.
* Data Modeling \\& Warehousing: Support the development of robust data models and schemas in both relational and cloud\\-native data warehouses (e.g., Google BigQuery).
* Ensure Data Integrity: Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve the performance and reliability of data pipelines, ensuring data quality, consistency, and accuracy.
* Data Source Integration: Work with various data formats and sources, including structured, semi\\-structured, and streaming data.
* Data Governance \\& Security: Collaborate with senior engineers to enforce data governance, quality, and security standards across the organization.
* Code \\& Automation: Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code (SQL, Python) for data engineering tasks. Utilize Git and CI/CD principles for version control and automated deployments.
* Team Collaboration: Document data workflows and contribute to a shared knowledge base, providing ad\\-hoc support to data analysts and business users.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
* Professional Experience: 1\\-3 years of hands\\-on experience in a data engineering or similar role.
* Technical Proficiency:
* Communication \\& Soft Skills:
* Availability: Able to join immediately.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About The Company**
 TBO.COM is a leading global travel technology company dedicated to transforming the way travel partners buy and sell travel services worldwide. Established in 2006, TBO has grown from a single product air ticketing platform to a comprehensive B2B travel ecosystem that offers a wide array of travel products including flights, hotels, rail, holiday packages, car rentals, transfers, sightseeing, cruises, and cargo services. Our proprietary technology platform leverages advanced AI and machine learning algorithms to deliver personalized and unique travel listings, enhancing customer experience and increasing conversion rates. With a strong focus on innovation, TBO.COM continuously invests in new technologies and platform enhancements to simplify complex travel needs and expand our global footprint. Our presence spans 47 countries physically, with active business operations in over 110 countries, making us a trusted partner in the travel industry worldwide.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join our dynamic team at TBO.COM. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and architectures that support our global travel ecosystem. Your expertise will enable us to harness large volumes of data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accessibility to support business analytics, reporting, and strategic decision\\-making. As a key member of our data team, you will collaborate closely with data scientists, analysts, and software engineers to implement innovative data solutions that drive our platform’s growth and operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in cloud\\-based data engineering, with a passion for building robust, scalable, and efficient data systems that align with our technology\\-first approach.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 The ideal candidate should have over three years of professional experience as a Data Engineer, with proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL, and data orchestration tools like Airflow. Hands\\-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly AWS, is essential, along with familiarity with services such as Kinesis, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Hive, and EMR. Knowledge of version control systems like GIT, and experience with ETL processes, data quality testing, cleansing, and monitoring are required. Additional expertise in databases such as Aerospike, Redis, MongoDB, SQL Server, and Apache Hudi is preferred. Familiarity with infrastructure\\-as\\-code tools like CDK, Terraform, or SAM is a plus. The candidate should demonstrate excellent organizational skills, be self\\-motivated, adaptable, and innovative in problem\\-solving approaches. A background in data sourcing, analysis, and understanding of data governance principles will be advantageous.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to support TBO.COM’s global travel platform. Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to gather data requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Implement and optimize ETL workflows, ensuring high data quality, integrity, and security. Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow and resolve any issues promptly. Leverage cloud services such as AWS to build and deploy data solutions, utilizing tools like Kinesis, EMR, and Hive. Manage version control and deployment processes using GIT and infrastructure\\-as\\-code frameworks like Terraform or CDK. Conduct data cleansing, validation, and testing to ensure accuracy and consistency across datasets. Contribute to the development of data models and architectures that enhance data accessibility and usability for analytics and reporting. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data engineering and cloud technologies, continuously seeking opportunities to improve platform performance and scalability.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At TBO.COM, we value our employees and offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your professional and personal growth. You will have the opportunity to work in an innovative, fast\\-paced environment that encourages creativity and continuous learning. We provide competitive compensation packages, health insurance, and wellness programs. Employees benefit from flexible working arrangements and a collaborative culture that promotes diversity and inclusion. Additionally, you will be part of a global organization that is shaping the future of travel technology, offering ample opportunities for career advancement and skill development. Our commitment to innovation and excellence ensures that your contributions will have a meaningful impact on our platform and the broader travel industry.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 TBO.COM is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees are valued and respected. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected status. We believe that diversity fosters innovation and drives our success, and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates.

title: Pega Tester (Associate and Senior Associate)

* Ability to validate rules, UI, case flows, integrations, and data integrity

title: Flow Assurance Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net\\-zero future. As one of the world’s largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.
   

  

 The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower\\-emissions technologies.
   

  

 We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society’s evolving needs. Learn more about
 **our What and our Why** 
 and how we can work
 **together** 
 .
   

  

**ExxonMobil’s affiliates in India**
 ExxonMobil’s affiliates have offices in India in Bengaluru, Mumbai and the National Capital Region.
   

  

 ExxonMobil’s affiliates in India supporting the Product Solutions business engage in the marketing, sales and distribution of performance as well as specialty products across chemicals and lubricants businesses. The India planning teams are also embedded with global business units for business planning and analytics.
   

  

 ExxonMobil’s LNG affiliate in India supporting the upstream business provides consultant services for other ExxonMobil upstream affiliates and conducts LNG market\\-development activities.
   

  

 The Global Business Center – Technology Center provides a range of technical and business support services for ExxonMobil’s operations around the globe.
   

  

 ExxonMobil strives to make a positive contribution to the communities where we operate and its affiliates support a range of education, health and community\\-building programs in India. Read more about our Corporate Responsibility Framework.
   

  

 To know more about ExxonMobil in India, visit ExxonMobil India and the Energy Factor India.
   

  

**What Role You Will Play In Our Team**
 The Flow Assurance Engineer is responsible for the design of oil and gas production systems and assessment of their operability, including wells, flow lines and risers, production and injection facilities, and pipelines.
   

  

 The Flow Assurance Engineer will use analytical and computational tools to predict the transient multiphase flow and thermal behavior of the production system and develops and documents functional requirements and operational strategies to prevent, mitigate, and remediate vulnerabilities associated with gas hydrate formation, wax deposition, and other solids
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* During the project cycle, Flow Assurance Engineers conduct technical studies to assess system operability, including:
* Fluid characterization using a thermodynamic simulator to model the PVT behavior of produced fluids
* Steady\\-state, single\\-phase flow modeling to size gas and/or water injection systems and pipelines
* Steady\\-state, multiphase fluid modeling to design production systems, including functional requirements for artificial lift and/or thermal insulation
* Transient, multiphase fluid modeling to assess thermal and hydraulic transients during production rate changes, turndown, startup, shutdown, and blow\\-down; including flow line and riser slugging, cool\\-down, and warm\\-up.
* Use of modeling and/or laboratory analysis to predict and assess solid formation, deposition, bedding and/or blockage behavior for hydrates, sand, wax, scale, asphaltenes, and other solids.
* Assessment of erosion and/or corrosion to guide proper material selection, conducted in collaboration with Materials Engineers.


**About You**
**Skills and Qualifications.**
* Bachelor's degree in engineering preferably in Chemical/Mechanical or Petroleum from a recognized university with CGPA 6\\.5 and above
* Minimum 3 years’ experience in Flow Assurance
* Minimum 2 years' experience in working software OLGA or PIPESIM
* Willingness and ability to travel internationally
* Demonstrated work experience as a flow assurance engineer on an oil or gas field development project
* Demonstrated work experience in development of multicomponent fluid characterizations using a thermodynamic or process simulator, such as PVTSIM, HYSYS, or equivalent
* Strong verbal communication and writing skills
* Should not have attended an interview for Flow Assurance Engineer position in the last 1 year


**Preferred Qualifications/ Experience**
* Formal training and demonstrated work experience in OLGA transient multiphase flow modeling
* Demonstrated work experience in prediction of gas hydrate formation and development of operational strategies for hydrate blockage prevention
* Demonstrated work experience in oil and gas process modeling, using HYSYS or equivalent
* Knowledge of Pipeline and Subsea engineering


**Your Benefits**
 An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep: our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life. We offer you:
   

  

* Competitive compensation
* Medical plans, maternity leave and benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment benefits
* Retirement benefits
* Global networking \\& cross\\-functional opportunities
* Annual vacations \\& holidays
* Day care assistance program
* Training and development program
* Tuition assistance program
* Workplace flexibility policy
* Relocation program
* Transportation facility


 Please note benefits may change from time to time without notice, subject to applicable laws. The benefits programs are based on the Company’s eligibility guidelines.
   

  

**Stay connected with us**
* Learn more about ExxonMobil in India, visit ExxonMobil India and Energy Factor India.
* Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
* Like us on Facebook
* Subscribe our channel at YouTube


**EEO Statement**
**ExxonMobil Is An Equal Opportunity Employer**
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or disability status.
   

  

**Business solicitation and recruiting scams**
 ExxonMobil does not use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind (e.g., placement fees, immigration processing fees, etc.). Follow the LINK to understand more about recruitment scams in the name of ExxonMobil.
   

  

 Nothing herein is intended to override the corporate separateness of local entities. Working relationships discussed herein do not necessarily represent a reporting connection, but may reflect a functional guidance, stewardship, or service relationship.
   

  

 Exxon Mobil Corporation has numerous affiliates, many with names that include ExxonMobil, Exxon, Esso and Mobil. For convenience and simplicity, those terms and terms like corporation, company, our, we and its are sometimes used as abbreviated references to specific affiliates or affiliate groups. Abbreviated references describing global or regional operational organizations and global or regional business lines are also sometimes used for convenience and simplicity. Similarly, ExxonMobil has business relationships with thousands of customers, suppliers, governments, and others. For convenience and simplicity, words like venture, joint venture, partnership, co\\-venturer, and partner are used to indicate business relationships involving common activities and interests, and those words may not indicate precise legal relationships.

title: Flutter Developer
description:
**About The Company**
 ACL Digital is a global leader in digital transformation, innovation, and technology solutions. With a strong presence across multiple industries including healthcare, finance, manufacturing, and retail, ACL Digital is committed to delivering cutting\\-edge solutions that enable businesses to achieve their strategic objectives. Our team of talented professionals leverages the latest advancements in technology such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and data analytics to create impactful and scalable solutions for our clients worldwide. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment that encourages continuous learning, creativity, and professional growth. At ACL Digital, we believe in empowering our employees to drive innovation and make a meaningful difference in the digital landscape.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Software Engineer to join our dynamic team at ACL Digital. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high\\-quality software solutions that meet client requirements and adhere to industry best practices. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative projects across diverse domains, utilizing the latest technologies and frameworks. The Software Engineer will collaborate closely with cross\\-functional teams including product managers, designers, and other developers to deliver robust, scalable, and efficient software applications. A strong problem\\-solving mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to adapt to rapidly changing project needs are essential for success in this position.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
* Proven experience of 3\\+ years in software development, with expertise in modern programming languages such as Java, Python, or C\\#.
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycle, Agile methodologies, and version control systems like Git.
* Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is desirable.
* Familiarity with front\\-end technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks such as React or Angular is a plus.
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills, analytical thinking, and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Effective communication skills and the ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to non\\-technical stakeholders.


**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement software solutions based on client specifications and project requirements.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to define technical requirements and translate them into scalable software applications.
* Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code following best practices and coding standards.
* Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and maintainability.
* Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, stand\\-ups, and retrospectives.
* Identify and troubleshoot software defects, perform root cause analysis, and implement appropriate fixes.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies to continuously improve development practices.
* Assist in the deployment and integration of software solutions into production environments.
* Support and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.


**Benefits**
 ACL Digital offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support the well\\-being and professional growth of our employees. Our offerings include competitive salary packages, health insurance, and retirement plans. We also provide opportunities for ongoing learning and development through training programs, certifications, and workshops. Employees have access to flexible working arrangements to promote work\\-life balance. Additionally, we foster a culture of recognition and reward, encouraging innovation and excellence. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion ensures a welcoming environment where every employee can thrive and contribute meaningfully to our collective success.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 ACL Digital is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe that diversity enhances our ability to innovate and serve our clients effectively. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are dedicated to providing a workplace that promotes respect, fairness, and opportunity for everyone.

title: Performance Engineering
description:
**Job Description**
 Value added Service \\[Acceptance Solutions]is a Product Development (PD) Group within the Technology Team. This group is responsible for building leading edge full\\-service Payment Solutions for our customers by combining global payment processing, fraud management, payment security and reporting systems. We are a group of bright, motivated engineers and technical managers excited about building the next generation of Payment products that will drive e\\-Commerce, mobile\\-Commerce as well as POS businesses for our customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accountable for creating application and infrastructure performance plans/models for a highly scalable, low\\-latency, highly\\-available and high\\-throughput payment processing system.
* Work with the architects and development team to ensure proper metrics instrumentation done in software components, to help facilitate real time and remote troubleshooting/performance monitoring.
* Hands on experience in Unix/Linux OS environments and operating system internals, file systems, disk/storage and networking protocols System internals. Having working knowledge with VMs and Containers.
* Expert knowledge and strong experience using tools, Loadrunner/Jmeter,. etc. and understanding of APM solutions like Appdynamics, dynatrace, OPNET,. etc
* Coding Knowledge in programming languages like Java/Python and scripting languages is must
* Evaluate, develop and execute load test tools to stress the limits of most critical payment applications.
* Understand and performance test the APIs, abstractions and integration patterns to solve challenging distributed computing problems.
* Should have experience in defining Performance Strategy and reporting performance baselines required to certify Go\\-Lives. Should have strong experience in handling multiple tasks and stakeholders
* Should be well versed in documenting the steps performed during course of performance tests cycle including performance test scripts used
* Should be able to able to look at the code and suggest optimization techniques.
* Should have ability to work independently and be a team player.
* Actively contribute to capacity planning and disaster recovery exercises.
* Support in triaging and troubleshooting of issues related to performance degradation incidents in production environment
* Monitor application performance, optimize performance bottlenecks and usage to create an application capacity model.
* Help optimizing system components such as CPU/Memory/Disk/Network \\& OS/Application software for maximizing the computer resources utilization.


**Requirements**
**Qualifications**
* Bachelors and/or Masters degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required
* 3 to 5 years of hands\\-on experience in Performance Engineering, Tuning, analysis or applications program development.


**We offer**
* Opportunity to work on bleeding\\-edge projects
* Work with a highly motivated and dedicated team
* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Benefits package \\- medical insurance, sports
* Corporate social events
* Professional development opportunities
* Well\\-equipped office


**About Us**
 Grid Dynamics (NASDAQ: GDYN) is a leading provider of technology consulting, platform and product engineering, AI, and advanced analytics services. Fusing technical vision with business acumen, we solve the most pressing technical challenges and enable positive business outcomes for enterprise companies undergoing business transformation. A key differentiator for Grid Dynamics is our 8 years of experience and leadership in enterprise AI, supported by profound expertise and ongoing investment in data, analytics, cloud \\& DevOps, application modernization and customer experience. Founded in 2006, Grid Dynamics is headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices across the Americas, Europe, and India.

title: Senior Pega Developer
description:
**About the Client** 




 Our client has recently secured a large\\-scale, enterprise\\-wide Pega transformation programme covering key domains across financial services, insurance, and healthcare.
 



  





 To support this initiative, they are partnering with us to build a pioneer team of 50 Pega professionals by year end covering the full delivery lifecycle from design to deployment.
 



  





 This is a rare opportunity to join a new Pega delivery organisation from the ground up, gain exposure to complex enterprise use cases, and accelerate your growth with a steep learning curve alongside certified architects, solution leaders, and Agile delivery teams.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




 We are hiring experienced Pega professionals (5–8 years) for Senior and Manager positions. You will lead solution design, collaborate with architects, guide development teams, and ensure high\\-quality delivery across the full Pega lifecycle.
 



  





 This role is ideal for CSSA\\-certified consultants who are comfortable working in Agile environments and managing complex technical workstreams.
 



  





**Job Responsibilities** 




  




* Design system, data, and integration architectures for enterprise Pega applications.
* Use advanced Pega capabilities to build efficient, secure, and scalable solutions.
* Design case management applications using
 **Constellation** 
 , ensuring guardrail compliance.
* Create detailed technical design documents and review with Lead System Architect (LSA).
* Implement workflows, rules, UI components, integrations, and data models.
* Build complex integrations using Oracle, LDAP, Active Directory, APIs, and web services.
* Execute unit and integration testing to ensure code quality and performance.
* Follow branching and ruleset management strategies defined by the LSA.
* Participate in configuration management and environment setup for deployments.
* Provide post\\-deployment support, bug fixes, and enhancements.
* Troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and unexpected system behaviour.
* Mentor junior developers and promote best practices.
* Collaborate with BAs, architects, and client teams to drive project goals.
* Help clients expand BPM adoption and identify new Pega automation opportunities.
* Build strong client relationships through clear communication and proactive engagement.



  





**Minimum Requirements** 



* Bachelor’s Degree (Computer Science, IT, Engineering, MIS, or related fields).
* 5–6 years experience for Senior Associate; 7–8 years for Manager.
* Strong experience in building enterprise Pega applications (case types, data models, decisions, integrations).
* Background in Agile delivery (Scrum/SAFe).
* Experience in Pega application deployment activities.
* Strong analytical skills, documentation ability, and stakeholder communication.
* Pega CSSA certification (mandatory).



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Domain experience in Banking (KYC, fraud, complaints),
* Insurance (claims, underwriting), or
* Healthcare (appeals, grievances, claims).
* Hands\\-on experience with Constellation.
* Experience identifying and resolving complex technical issues.



  





**Why Join** 



* Be part of major, multi\\-year Pega transformation programmes.
* Work with top\\-tier architects and global delivery teams.
* Fast\\-track growth into solutions leadership roles.
* Exposure to modern Pega capabilities including
 **Constellation, DevOps, and next\\-gen integration frameworks** 
 .
* Collaborative, high\\-performance consulting environment.



  





**What you need to do now** 




 If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' or reach out to Carson Wong at c.wong@masonfrank.com with an up\\-to\\-date copy of your CV.
